alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Outagamie; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 11 at 5:24PM CDT until April 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Wednesday Afternoon... .Record to near record warm temperatures, in combination with winds gusting in the 25 to 35 mph range and minimum relative humidity values nearing 25 percent are leading to the possibility of critical fire weather conditions in portions of central and east central Wisconsin. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EAST CENTRAL WISCONSIN... * AFFECTED AREA...Wood, Portage, Waupaca, Outagamie, Waushara, Winnebago and Calumet. * TIMING...From Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 70s to middle 80s. * IMPACTS...Fires will start easily and spread quickly in these conditions. So outdoor burning should not be attempted. Visit the Wisconsin DNR website and click on the appropriate county to view current burning restrictions.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions may occur. A combination of strong winds, very low relative humidity, warm temperatures, and exceptionally dry fuels may create dangerous wildland fire conditions. Firefighters, emergency management, and law enforcement should monitor forecasts for updates on this potentially dangerous wildland fire situation.

area.areaDesc: Calumet; Outagamie; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood
